content.rendered:
A message from the Manager

Since the last communication I have now been Home Manager for coming up to three months and I honestly don’t know where the time has gone; I guess time the saying is true “time flies when you’re having fun!”.
We also have a new hairdresser Yvonne who is now in weekly to make theresidents hair look lovely.
I know many of you are on our Monson Retirement Home Facebook page, if I couldplease ask for you all to continue to like our new page ‘Monson Care’. This is where all new photos & news will appear including our recent employees of the month.
We will also use the page to keep everyone updated with new events, suchas our new “Early onset dementia café morning” starting every Thursday from the19th August 2021 supported by Jane Robinson, one of our residents’ daughters. Thank you to Jane 😊
As a home, we continue to make the care personal to each resident, whilst we do have generic toiletries available, it would be wonderful if families could continue to please bring intheir loved ones’ favourite items to use.
We believe it is the small things in life that create comfort, especially for the residents.
It really is wonderful to see so many ofyou continuing to visit as things have relaxed more in terms of Covid19 restrictions – I recently sent out updated guidance on visiting to your personal emails plus the new questionnaire which needs to be completed.
To continue to book please ring us and we will be happy to help.
Stay safe, Joshua

 

WHAT’S BEEN HAPPENING THIS MONTH

Time for a BBQ

We took advantage of the nice weather to get some much needed sun & enjoy a BBQ outside. It was great to see everyone enjoying themselves & eating some delicious food prepared by the chef. Hopefully that’s not not the last BBQ this summer.

 

New furniture is in

For those who have visited recently orwho are keeping an eye on our social media, you have have noticed we’ve gotsome lovely new furniture from the teamat Teal, a specialist provider of softfurnishings for care homes. We’re committed to continuing to investing the home & our residents are already enjoying the added comfort!

 

OOMPH partnership

We’re delighted to say we have partnered with Oomph! to supplement the range of activities we offer at Monson.
Oomph is an online platform which specialises in providing engaging content & activities aimed to enhance the mental, physical and emotional wellbeing of care home residents.
We’re excited to get started! Keep an eye on our Facebook to see what we’re up to.

 

Employee of the month

A huge well done to Katy, who is our Employee of the Month for July 2021.
Congratulations & thank you from everyone at Monson, and the wider Autograph team.

 

Thank you Tish & Team!

A special well done to Tish Bates for all her work organising the Dementia UK fundraising event. The team raised a fantastic £184.32 for a great cause.
The certificate arrived & is proudly on display! Such a worthy cause and one close to all our hearts. Well done everyone you’re an amazing team.

 

Happy Birthday to you

With so many residents having birthdays in July, it’s been celebrations and happy times all round. True to form, everyone has celebrated in style with some beautiful cakes and fun activities #teammonson

 

Early onset Dementia morning cafe

Every Thursday at 11am. Support for those impacted by early onset dementia. Get in touch for more information or visit our website.

 

Remember we have 3 weeks for 2 on selected respite stays

Do you know of anyone who needs a break, or a change of scenery? Ask them to get in touch, quoting #3for2

excerpt.rendered: A summary of everything we’ve been up to in July 2021 including BBQs, new furniture, fundraising and birthdays!

@graph.description: Joshua is the Care Home Manager at Monson and is passionate about caring for the elderly, having worked in care for over 11 years. “I aim to take the home forward into the future and build strong relations with our residents and loved ones”.
